StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NIDDK International IBD Genetics Consortium Repository Global Screening Array

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Recruitment of study participants, phenotyping and Global Screening Array was conducted by the NIDDK International IBD Genetics Consortium (IIBDGC). IIBDGC investigators include: Dr. Steven R. Brant (John’s Hopkins University), Dr. Judy H. Cho (Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai), Dr. Richard H. Duerr (University of Pittsburgh), Dr. Dermot B. P. McGovern (Cedars-Sinai Medical Center), Dr. John D. Rioux (Montréal-Boston Collaborative IBD Genetic Research Center) and Dr. Mark S. Silverberg (University of Toronto, Samuel Lunenfeld Research Institute, Mount Sinai Hospital. The results published here are in part based on data or bio-samples obtained from the IBD Plexus program of the Crohn’s & Colitis Foundation. The IBDGC is supported by the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK). The data reported here were supplied by the IBDGC’s Data Coordinating Center. This manuscript was not prepared in collaboration with the IBDGC and does not necessarily reflect the opinions or views of the IBDGC investigators or the NIDDK.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB, NPU, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB-NPU-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Inflammatory Bowel Disease, IRB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-IBD-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Inflammatory Bowel Disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
